pullRequest.body:
This consists on easy generalizations and lemmas relative to the weight of finsupp functions,
that will be used in the formalization of Alon's combinatorial Nullstellensatz #20495


---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

```suggestion
import Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Ring.Canonical
import Mathlib.Data.Finsupp.Antidiagonal
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Finsupp.LinearCombination
```

```suggestion
  The present choice is to have it defined as a function.
```

```suggestion
We fix a type `Ïƒ`, a semiring `N`, a `N`-module `M`,
```
maybe?
I would rather call the semiring `R`. `N` makes it sound like it plays an analogous role to `M` (which is really not what's happening)
`N` was viewed as a proxy to `Nat`.
Yes, I know. But given the proximity of `M` in the alphabet, it seems better to use a completely different letter. Eg we don't use `Z` as a letter for euclidean domains

```suggestion
  rw [weight_apply, Finsupp.sum_single_index]
  simp -- or something like that
```
no?
Noâ€¦
(The smul has to enter the single, and then it doesn't seem to reach to anywhere useful).

The way the `Finsupp` API deals with the problem of determining which argument of a binary function a name atom corresponds to is by appending `_index` when it is the first argument (eg `Finsupp.sum_single` vs `Finsupp.sum_single_index`. So what about
```suggestion
theorem weight_single_index (s : Ïƒ) (c : M) (f : Ïƒ â†’â‚€ N) :
    weight (single s c) f = f s â€¢ c := by
```
...

... then this can become
```suggestion
theorem weight_single (s : Ïƒ) (n : N) :
    weight w (Finsupp.single s n) = n â€¢ w s := by
```

```suggestion
  apply ((fun d : Ïƒ â†’â‚€ â„• => (weight w) d) '' (Ï†.support : Set (Ïƒ â†’â‚€ â„•))).toFinite.subset
```

```suggestion
theorem degree_zero : degree (0 : Ïƒ â†’â‚€ N) = 0 := by simp [degree]
```
I think the "plain" was quite relevant?

pullRequest.title: refactor(Data/Finsupp/Weight.lean): generalize and add lemmas
